cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly tracking west-northwest toward the middle–upper Texas coast, then expected to turn north and northeast across the Houston/Galveston area and into Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay–Freeport, TX (middle–upper Texas coast)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA for TS winds; Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA for storm surge
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle-upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay and southwestern Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40-50 mph with higher gusts) likely Monday and Tuesday in the Houston/Galveston area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and along the upper Texas coast, including the Houston Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rainfall of 8–12 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents; extended periods of restricted vessel traffic and possible port closure.
